description: I like to use this software for quick extracts.

Sound Juicer used to be a great ripping tool back in the days. But since the developer(s) decided to hide the bitrate settings and make it really hard to change the bitrates, it became a worthless piece of software. If you're looking for a decent CD-ripper, try Asunder.
Sound Juicer is quite slim and easy to understand. Unfortunately too slim, because it is not even possible to setup the sample Bit Rate.
summary: Unfortunately not able to set bit rate

description: The app simply lacks essential features.
summary: Can't choose bitrate, can't choose format

description:
Sound Juicer doesn't let the user decide which compression level (FLAC) or which bitrate the ripped audio file should have. Unfortunately it does also not choose the best compression level as default.

It does the job (ripping a CD), but it is quite useless without the ability to select the desired compression/bitrate. I'd recommend Asunder instead, which is equally simple and GTK-based, but gives the user control over essential settings.

This thing works and is very simple to use.

To set the desired format (FLAC, MP3, Vorbis, Opus), use the Preferences in the app menu. You indeed can't set the bit rate but e.g. for MP3 it just uses the maximum variable bit rate setting which makes sense given current hard disk capacities and the fact that most people would like their music to continue sounding good.
summary: Does what it is supposed to

description:
No ability to do ANYTHING except stick in a CD and hit "extract"
You must accept the default horrible highly lossy .oog, the default folders etc.
Worst program ever -5 REMOVED

No settings!
cant change bit rate
Cant rip to MP3!
Useless!
Apparently this once upon a time was quite a useful piece of software, but now you cannot select bitrate. Makes it quite useless.
No option to select 320 kbps bit rate for mp3s.
summary: One size does not fit all

description: I find it rips the tracks very very slowly, like almost at playing speed. And there is no setting for sample rate. I like how simple it is, but I don't love how slow it is.
What everyone else has said already: too limited, can't set bit rate, slow.
Only rips to .ogg and it doesn't tell you prior to doing so.

It is simple and works and does do good rips. There are other reviews that are saying that there is no way to change settings. Simply click on the "Sound Juicer" on the upper left of the window. It has a pull down menu and you can find most of what you need there.
This is a great app and it works perfectly for me to rip cds to digital files.

I was able to rip one CD with this. I had the additional libraries for Ubuntu installed, so I was able to rip to mp3. However, when I put in a second CD, it kept showing me the track information for the first CD. (CD #1 had track information online, #2 did not). I restarted the program and only put in CD #2 but it said it couldn't find track information and then left me unable to do anything. At least read the track information and let me edit the names myself. Oh, and as everyone else has said, let me adjust the bitrate settings!
summary: Nice and simple, but lacking some features

description: You can't pick the format anymore. It's completely and utterly useless.
summary: R.I.P. Another victim of gnome feature removal syndrome

description:
First of all, very limited options to edit the metadate. There is no comments, or description option. Editing the metadata of multiple tracks at once is also not feasible. It's one or all. Very infuriating. 
You can't edit the year of individual tracks. There really ought to be an option to add/view different columns you can edit. 
As others have pointed out, NO bitrate. Major oversight there.
Also, as of this writing, you can't rip/extract in WAV or AIFF. 
Actually, I would give 0 stars if I could.
summary: Limited metadata editing. No Bitrate. Limited format options

description:
Cannot open a preferences window for the application in Ubuntu 18.04 without editing configuration for Gnome desktop.

It works but only with default settings. A giant step back in usability for Ubuntu.

I needed a simple way to rip CDs into my Plex library, and this was perfect for what I needed. It's default naming scheme didn't need any adjusting and ripping is quick and efficient. Just what I needed.

I read a review saying, even though we can't choose birate but it extract with highest bitrate.
So I think, okay i'll give it a go.
After first rip and check using "file" command, it shows:
Audio file with ID3 version 2.4.0, contains:MPEG ADTS, layer III, v1, 48 kbps, 44.1 kHz, JntStereo


Serious? 48k? I haven't even seen this bitrate before! for AM Radio?
Do everybody a favour, just remove the mp3 option, and simply state that you don't do mp3
No possibility to choose extraction file type.
summary: Do not download if you want 320 kpbs MP3 - Only extracts OGG files

description: I echo those who can't find where to configure this app. 	Mav on 10/27/19 said click on the Sound Juicer label on upper left. The Sound Juicer I just installed has no such feature. Anyone have any ideas? Without it, this app is not much use.
...So, useless.

Not a bad solution but I have a feeling it could be better still. First, I would like to see the option of multiple conversions in a single click so preferences that, for instance allow me to select say, MP3, FLAC and probably WAV all at once so that when I come back to the machine I can see they have all been done. I would also like the parameters for the MP3 option available so that I can select exactly what extraction I want. I know the default isn't bad but hey! You never know if you could make it better!

This works just as described. Despite what others have written, you can rip to MP3. It's all under Preferences in the SoundJuicer drop-down menu. https://help.gnome.org/users/sound-juicer/stable/preferences.html.en
You cannot change the bitrates/quality of the output format.
summary: Easy to use - but maybe too easy

description: Very configurable.
summary: Really great App. I just cant fault it at all

description: This app was really great for turning my CDs into MP3 files for a couple years, but now it seems to be getting slower and taking a longer time to rip CDs, going from 6-9 minutes at 9-10x speed to 15-25 minutes at 2-4x speed. Still works, but takes forever to rip several discs
I only extract from the audio cd to my hard drive using flac. No compression, now worries. Once there I use sound converter to create opus files for my mobile. Takes only a few seconds. Perfect combo
I just need something to rip CDs, easy to operate and no frills. This works great!
Very good. Is not reed full text data from audio cd but is fine.
The bug for that has been open since 2017.
I was looking for an MP3 ripper and this is not it. If you're fine for .ogg format, its slow but probably works just fine.
summary: This does NOT rip to MP3 format

description: It is simple and very useful and good-working. SoundJuicer simply do the job.

But does not seem to have a wav output setting only rip to 5 smaller extentions and no cd track info so its not for me
for settings on this one click on the title top left also dont see quality rate settings so it might rip in fixed settings for mp4 ogg opus etc.
What more could you asked it worked and worked well!
Rips to FLAC; which is all I could ask for. Set your preferences before you start.
Easy to use and efficient. Support loseless format. It's perfect for my usage.
Does just want I needed. Ripped music from CD's and could use my own labels. Clear and easy to use.

I don't have to sue the developers of this programme for being dirty, dirty liars because they didn't lie. It rips CD's to various different file formats and has sensible defaults.
The defaults can be changed though, and the various options are wonderful and have made my life better.
Rhythmbox wasn't letting me extract songs from a CD as mp3. I was getting so frustrated. Then i found out about Sound juicer. Very pleased.
A lot of negative reviews due to lack of settings menu. But, as another poster said, you CAN get to the settings by clicking on the "Sound Juicer" in the top left corner. Not obvious, but it is there
summary: How to get to the settings - IMPORTANT

description:
A wonderful program that does exactly what I need it to with no fluff, and no bugs.

If you need to quickly rip a lot of CDs into neatly organized audio files, this is the software for you!

Aunder ripped my cds straight away!
Have no idea why Sound Juicer keep saying my dvd drive is missing, too bad, I was really liking it

May work fine under Gnome, but is absolutely worthless on the Steam Deck's KDE implementation.

1) Complains that it cannot find an optical device. Program closes as soon as warning is acknolaged.
2) When overriden with `flatpak run org.gnome.SoundJuicer -d /dev/sr0`, it complains about missing HAL daemon.

Works, and is easy to use. I especially like the selection of meta data that lets you select a disc among many suggestions.

The configuration of encoding leaves a bit to be desired. At least it should state how the encoder is configured.
Simple to use but is missing encoding to VBR mp3.

es gibt ja zig Anleitungen zu diesem Programm, wie man in den Einstellungen dann mp3 auswählt und auch den Zielordner festlegen kann. Nur in dieser Version fehlt die Menüzeile! Nirgends die "Einstellungen" zu finden, wo man dann was verändern könnte?! Auch auf dem offiziellen Screenshot fehlt bei dieser Version die Menüzeile. Hab ein anderes (rx) und da funktioniert das problemlos.
summary: fehlende Menüzeile, wie also mp3 Format einstellen?

description: unklare Empfehlung, wichtige Einflußnahmemöglichkeiten fehlen, stimme Herrn Moser vollumfänglich zu.
Einfach zu bedienen und macht genau das, was man erwartet,
...die Einstellungen befinden sich unterhalb der Titelleiste hinter "Sound Juicer"...
Works perfectly fine. MP3 is not available out of the box (extra package has to be installed). I guess this is because of patent issues.

Benutze Sound Juicer seit Jahren. Ziemlich gut. One thing and do it well und so.
Aber die Einstellungsmenüzeile ist in den letzten Versionen verschwunden und ich kann weder das CD Laufwerk, noch den Speicherort, noch das Audioformat umstellen. Was ist denn da passiert???

Einzig das Einstellungsmenü (für Format, Speicherort, etc.) ist in der aktuellen Version in ein unscheinbares Icon linksoben im App-Fenster gewandert, musste länger suchen, bis ich das Icon als "klickbar"erkennen konnte. Ansonsten tut das Programm genau das, was es soll!

Ich kann mich Herrn Moser nur anschließen. Früher war die Menüleiste sichtbar, jetzt verschwunden. Der Punkt ist seit geraumer Zeit bekannt und immer noch nicht behoben. Wahrscheinlich unter Ubuntu schon lange gefixt, bei Debian muss so eine Reklamation immer erst mal gut abhängen und reifen. Schade.

Es gibt gar keine Einstellmöglíchkeiten (mehr). Andere Programme erkennen die CD automatisch. Dieses nicht. Es gibt auch kein Menü, in dem man das Laufwerk zuordnen könnte. Übrig bleibt nur eine leere Maske.

Einfaches Programm, macht genau was es soll!
Keinerelei Beschwerden!

Eigentlich genial, musicbrainz mit drin, wenige sinnvolle Einstellungen. Tipp Topp, aber seit ca. einem Jahr werden die Einstellungen nicht mehr im Menü angeboten. Macht mir nichts, weil ich alles so habe wie ich brauche, aber wenn ich mal den Speicherort der gerippten Dateien ändern will, dann werde ich auf dem Trockenen sitzen. Schade.

All needed settings without overwhelming features.
It just does what it is supposed to do.
summary: Nice and easy Audio CD ripper

description:
2 Laufwerke, kein Leseergebnis, erkennt normale Audio-CDs nicht.
Daher leider nicht brauchbar für mich.
Kam mit free.ac nicht weiter, da mehrere Auslesefehler. Sound Juicer hats dann gepackt...
estaria bien poder elegir la base de datos a la que conectarse hay alternativas a musicbrainz
summary: recomendable para ripear cda sobretodo los oficiales

description: A estas fechas ya casi no se encuentran discos de música. Por eso es genial para obtener esas pieza que no siempre se encuentran en la red. Yo sigo usádola y nunca me ha dado problemas. Muy recomendable.
Funciona a la perfección y con buena calidad, no le veo ningún pero y no entiendo los que le ponen votos negativos a la aplicación, debe ser que no tienen ni idea de como funciona.
Ocupa poco espacio, es muy amigable y teine lo justo para su cometido.
summary: Es una aplicacio sencilla liviana, que cumple muy bien su cometido

description: Extrae bien los archivos de audio de un CD
mas simple y fácil de usar imposible
Es una aplicación que nunca me ha fallado y funciona muy bien.
Está bien que sea una aplicación simple pero que no puedas seleccionar la tasa de bits es una carencia importante.
summary: No deja establecer la tasa de bits

description: no me deja descargarla
Le format par défaut est le OGG qui n'est pas lu par le lecteur de la voiture. Dommage; Un couplage avec Sound Converter aurait été plus rusé.
summary: Ne permet pas de régler le format de sortie

description: Quand je lis que certains n'aiment pas car il fait du ogg... il suffit d'aller changer le format d'export dans les paramètres. Cet outil fait le taff et bien, je recommande.
je n'ai pas trouvé où régler les paramètres: format de sortie, dossier, nom du fichier, ...

Pour ceux qui utilise Ubuntu 18.04 on peut changer les (paramètres) de sortie audio en cliquant sur 'Sound Juicer' dans la liste des Activités. Puis dans le menu déroulant qui apparaît cliquer ensuite sur 'Préférences'
summary: J'aime mais un peu lent pour extraire plusieurs pistes sur un CD

description: Fonctionne tres bien son seul defaut : un peu lent ! Pour les novices, il est possible de changer le format de conversion dans le menu soundjuicer/preference. Il est compatible oggVorbis, Flac, mp3.
Merci à Paule pour avoir indiqué, dans les commentaires, aux novices où trouver les paramètres
super mais qu'el domage on a pas du mp3
summary: super cette extration on a ogg vorbis la calité et mieux que le mp3

description: Malgré ce qu'un précédent commentaire indique, impossible d'avoir du FLAC (ou du MP3) plutôt que du OGG (qui ne peut être lu par une voiture, du moins l'immense majorité), cette application n'offre aucune possibilité de paramétrage, ni dans la fenêtre de l'application, ni dans son menu dans la barre du shell.
télécharger la musique en mp3 impossible qu'el domage car le vobis pas compatible en mais clé
Le logiciel fait le taf pour extraire des CD

Pour les boulets : "préférences" accesibles en cliquant sur
"Sound Juicer".

Fait très bien le taff, pour ceux qui n'arrive toujours pas à changer le format de sortie il faut cliquer sur sound juicer puis aller dans préférences et tout en bas modifier dans le menu déroulant de format de sortie
ferme stupidement et refuse d'ouvrir simplement parce que j'ai mis un cd dans le lecteur cd externe et non interne (problème d'ouverture). incompréhensible.
Je ne peux pas l'ouvrir donc je n'en pense rien!!!
